page.title: 11Whitelye Methodist Chapel
page.content: Whitelye Methodist Chapel was built in l86O as a place of religion. Local labourers, who fealt they needed somewhere to worship, paid for the materials and helped to build it, under the supervision of a qualified builder. At the moment there is a sunday school of l3. The service starts at ll o'clock with a hymn and a bible story, then a game and a quiz based on the bible story. The service ends at l2.l5pm. On Sunday evenings at 6.l5pm there is a church service. First there is a hymn, then the laypreacher says a prayer followed by more hymns and a sermon and finally the grace is sung. Sadly these services are under threat of closure because so few people are going.
